docTitle.titlePart: HOUSEHOLD GODS A Comedy By Aleister Crowley

set.p: SCENE THE HEARTH OF CRASSUS ; AFTERWARDS THE LAWNS , THE WOODS , THE LAKE , THE ISLE .

castItem.roleDesc: his wife , a noble Roman lady

set.p: THE SCENE is at the hearth of CRASSUS , where is a little bronze altar dedicated to the Lares and Penates . A pale flame rises from the burning sandal-wood , on which CRASSUS throws benzoin and musk . He is standing in deep dejection .

sp.speaker: CRASSUS
sp.p: Smoke without fire ! No thrill of tongues licks up The offerings in the cup . Dead falls desire . Black smoke thou art , O altar-flame , that dost dismember , Devour the hearth , to leave no ember To warm this heart . I see her still - Adela dancing here Till dim gods did appear To work our will . The delicate girl ! Diaphanous gossamer Subtly revealing her Brave breast of pearl ! Now - she 's withdrawn At dusk to the wild woods , Mystic beatitudes That dure till dawn . Let life exclaim Against these things of spirit , Mankind that disinherit Of love 's pure flame !He bends before the altar and begins to weep .Ye household gods ! By these male tears I swear That ye shall grant this prayer . All things at odds Shall be put straight - Harmonized , reconciled By some appointed child Of some far Fate !A curtain has been drawn aside during this invocation , and ALICIA advances . She smiles subtly upon him ; and , giving a strange gesture , makes one or two noiseless steps of dancing .

sp.speaker: ALICIA
sp.p: Master still sad ?

lg.l: These faint and fearful shores
Of time are beaten by the surge of sense ,
Love worn away - by love ? - to indifference .
Who knows what god - or demon - she adores ?
Or in what wood she shelters , or what grove
Sees her profane our sacrament of love ?

sp.speaker: ALICIA
sp.p: I saw her follow The stream in the hollow Where never Apollo Abides . So thick are the trees That never the breeze Stirs them , or sees What satyr inhabits the glen , what nymph in the pools of it hides . Lighter of foot Than a sylph or a fairy , Sinuous , wary , I passed from the airy Lawns , where the flute Of the winds made tremulous music for man . I followed the ripple Of the stream ; I crept Where the waters wept - The floss in the foss Gurgling across The bosses of moss , Like a dryad 's nipple In the mouth of Pan !

sp.speaker: CRASSUS
sp.p: O pearl of the house ! you came to the end ?

sp.speaker: ALICIA
sp.p: The dusk of the slave , the dawn of a friend ?

sp.speaker: CRASSUS
sp.p: Freedom is thine for the skill and the will .

lg.l: The skill is mine - but the will lies still ,
Still as the earth that dare not stir
Till the kiss of the sun awaken her !

sp.speaker: CRASSUS
sp.p: Yet at these secrets and riddles ? Behold ! I can fill thy lap with a harvest of gold .

lg.l: Yet all the gold you could give to me
Would fall at my feet when I rose to be free .

sp.speaker: CRASSUS
sp.p: What will you then ?

lg.l: No gift from men .
Of my own free will I give you wit ,
lg.stage: O man so sorely in need of it !
lg.l: And happiness ; and the flame that hath dwindled
On this dull hearth shall be rekindled .
But this you must swear :
To will , and to dare ,
To seek the spirit and slay the sense ;
And for this hour
To give me power
To lead you in silent obedience ,
Though I bade you fall on your sword ....

sp.speaker: CRASSUS
sp.p: Enough ! I give my life as I gave my love .

lg.l: O ! love you have not understood .
You have not guessed its secret food .
You have not seen its single eye ;
But fear and doubt and jealousy
Have risen , and now your love is trembling
Like a mountebank dissembling
When his trick 's detected . Come !
To find home we must leave home .
Starless and moonless , hidden in cloud ,
The night 's one flame of pearl .

sp.speaker: ALICIA
sp.p: The bat flaps ; the owl hoots aloud .

sp.speaker: CRASSUS
sp.p: Lead on ; I trust you , girl .

lg.l: You are bold to trust me ; or , have you divined
My secret ?
No ; the crystal of your mind
Shows only faint disturbing images ,
Things passing strange , as if enchanted seas
Kept their great swell upon it , and strange fish
Played in its oily depths . Some monstrous wish ,
The shadow of some unspeakable desire ,
Strikes my heart cold , and sets my brain on fire .
Learn this , as we pass through the portico :
Fear nothing ; there is nothing you can know !
And by these terraces and steps that gleam
Wintry , although the summer night is hot ,
This - what we seek is never what we find !
Life is a dream , like love ; and from the dream
If we may wake , we never find it what
We would ; for the wisdom of a mightier mind
Leads us in its own ways
To a perfected praise .
Why are these shadows thrown across the lawn
From the elms and yews ? They were not wont to reach
Beyond the branches of that copper-beech .
Attend the dawn
Of an unknown comet , that shall come
From the unfathomable wells of space
Into its halidom .
I know it not . Last night I walked alone
Here , and saw nothing .
I was not with you !
There is no God upon the eternal throne
Of stars begemming the bewildering blue
Unless one has the eyes to see him . Think
How we two stand upon the brink
Of nothing ! Here 's a globe , whereto we trust ,
No larger than the smallest speck of dust
Or mote in the sunbeam is to that sun 's self ,
And we are like dead leaves in autumn 's whil
Of wind upon it .
Mystify me , girl !
It is the right of an elf .
Surely your flickering fire
Will draw me to some mire !
Here the stream dips its mouth into the wood .
So does youth 's calm and chaste beatitude
Touch the black mouth of Love , the ancient whore .

sp.speaker: CRASSUS
sp.p: Girl ! what a scorpion leaping from your lips !

sp.speaker: ALICIA
sp.p: My mouth stings as no scorpion ever stang . in this round impudent smiling face of mine There is a poison fiercer than all wine ; And from these eyes more subtle sorrows pour Than you can dream . These teeth have been at grips With gods ; I have sung what no girl ever sang . These ears have heard An insufferable word !

sp.speaker: CRASSUS
sp.p: What do you mean ?

lg.l: The secret 's in a kiss .
Here are no kisses . Here great Artemis
Rules ; only in the woodland may a man
Hide his eyes from her , pledge himself to Pan .
Come ! through the tangled arches
Of cypresses and larches ,
Stoop ; under Artemis we walked upright ;
But this is Pan 's home , and the House of Night .

sp.speaker: CRASSUS
sp.p: So when I stoop , my cheek comes close to yours . Give me a kiss .

lg.l: The poisonous apple lures
Thus the boy 's mouth . Beware !
O you are fair !
Fairer than ever ! In this tangle of trees
Your hot breath wraps you in perfume .
There is some gloom or doom ,
A bitter harsh ingredient
In these my sorceries
Of animal scent .

sp.speaker: CRASSUS
sp.p: Yes ! there is fear mixed with the fascination . It is the reverence that chastity , be sure ! Gains from the impure .

lg.l: O virtuous nation !
It is the fear of the uninitiate
Before the throne of Fate
The hierophant .

sp.speaker: CRASSUS
sp.p: Kiss me , however !

lg.l: Did I grant
This favour , all were lost . It is your truth
To Adela that tempts my youth .
lg.stage: Henceforth Alicia shakes with silent laughter .

sp.speaker: CRASSUS
sp.p: What little breasts you have !

sp.speaker: ALICIA
sp.p: Ay , maiden breasts ! Would you betray my oath ?

lg.l: My will contests
My wishes .
Wait , and you shall surely see
Part of the secret that ensorcels me .
See all these bosses ! It is not
As if a Titan smote himself into the earth ,
And was caught into her , made one with her ?
The scent is fierce and hot
Like a rutting panther 's slot .
Yet you are matched with mirth ,
Shaking each other like two wrestlers .
What should stir
Your melancholy but laughter ?
Look , before us
Light streams , a tremulous chorus .
Oh , it is vague and vacillating !
Love ,
Young love of maidens , is the soul thereof .
And in the midst , behold , O man !
The image of great Pan .

sp.speaker: CRASSUS
sp.p: I fear him .

lg.l: Go and lie there , at his feet .
Lie supine ! Lie on that moss-covered root ,
While I draw forth the flute
And make a marvellous music .
lg.stage: She ceases laughing and begins to play .

lg.l: O I writhe
Beneath the force of lips , of fingers lithe
That touch the delicate stops so delicately .

sp.speaker: ALICIA
sp.p: Hush ! I have drawn the bird from the bush . Pan will appear anon .

sp.speaker: CRASSUS
sp.p: Ah ! Ah ! ... Ah ! Ah !

lg.l: This music moves you . Now I 'll play a tune
That would make mad the melancholy moon .
This .
Ah ! you tear my soul out with the trills .
Your fingers play like summer lightning on the shaft .
It is like a storm on the mountains when it shrills ;
Like the angry sea when it booms . Hark !

sp.speaker: ALICIA
sp.p: Some god laughed .

lg.l: Your mouth is like some god 's It burns and blooms
With fire unheard of , with unguessed perfumes .
O let me kiss you !

sp.speaker: ALICIA
sp.p: So you stop my song !She ceases the tune .

sp.speaker: CRASSUS
sp.p: There is another song .

sp.speaker: ALICIA
sp.p: You do me wrong . For you love Adela !

sp.speaker: CRASSUS
sp.p: By God , girl , no ! I love Alicia .

sp.speaker: ALICIA
sp.p: Ah ! you love her SO !She laughs

sp.speaker: CRASSUS
sp.p: Your laugh is shocking - why do you mock me , dear ?

lg.l: Because you will not guess my secret here .
But - put your arms about my neck , and swar
You love me , and will always keep them there .
Then I might dare .

sp.speaker: CRASSUS
sp.p: I swear it . O my sweet !

sp.speaker: ALICIA
sp.p: Then take my kiss .

sp.speaker: CRASSUS
sp.p: Your mouth is like a rose of fire . But what is this ? I cannot bear it .

sp.speaker: ALICIA
sp.p: Ai ! Uhu ! Uhu ! It is my heart ; this arrow strikes me through . Stir not one muscle for a moment . Death ! You beast , you kill me with your urgent breath .

sp.speaker: CRASSUS
sp.p: O how I love you !He moves violently .

lg.l: Fool ! Now all my pain
Must be gone through again .
It is sure your chastity 's unstained by crime ;
You do the wrong thing just at the right time !
Why do you taunt me ? All the wood is spring 's ,
And love is hovering o'er us with his wings .

sp.speaker: ALICIA
sp.p: Sub pennis , penis !

sp.speaker: CRASSUS
sp.p: Hush ! you break the spell .

lg.l: Oh ! you great fools fo men , I know you well .
But nothing is so detrimental
To love as to be sentimental .
I will yet make you wise .
Know that I have the magic to disguise
Myself in manyt ways . Do you feel this ?
lg.stage: Lie still , this heaven were ruined by a kiss !
lg.l: I am a butterfly , such idle flitting
As to a flower like you is fitting
Now I 'm a mole . Do you think you know me now ?
Here is the earthworm severed by the plough .
You are a witch . I want your love ; you give
Only love 's comedy .
The way to live
Is to find comedy and tragedy
In everything . But if you cannot see
Through to the Bacchanal spirit , this should suit .
Here is the blacksmith hammering a flute .

sp.speaker: CRASSUS
sp.p: Oh love , love , kiss me !

lg.l: I will forge a ring
Of bloom of blood-kisses upon your neck ,
Till it is like a garden of roses in late spring .

sp.speaker: CRASSUS
sp.p: “ Soft , and stung softly , fairer for a fleck . ”

sp.speaker: ALICIA
sp.p: O marvellous nation ! Vanity , dullness , slobber , and quotation !

sp.speaker: CRASSUS
sp.p: Why do you love me if you scorn me so ?

sp.speaker: ALICIA
sp.p: Why , did I say I loved you ? I say no .

sp.speaker: CRASSUS
sp.p: Why do you make love ?

lg.l: To beguile the hour ;
To crown my rose-wreath with a greener flower ’
To do my master 's bidding , that 's to give
Life to yourself , who only think you live .
But listen ! Have you seen the nine waves roll
Monotonous upon the shoal ,
Rising and falling like a maiden asleep ;
Then with a lift and a leap
The ninth wave curls , and breaks upon the beach ,
And rushes up it , swallowing the sand ?
I am that ocean .... Now , you understand ?

sp.speaker: CRASSUS
sp.p: Alicia ! O ! this is unbearable . Surely this wave washes the shore of hell !

lg.l: Each follows each
Remorseless and indifferent as Nature
Is to each creature .

sp.speaker: CRASSUS
sp.p: Wonderful , wonderful woman !She throws her head back , and laughs

lg.l: Now , you think
You know my secret . I have given you drink ,
And you are wise . But hush ! to all emotion
Save this the pulse and swell of Ocean
For at the last with mouth and fingers wried
All must proclaim the triumph of the tide .

sp.speaker: CRASSUS
sp.p: Ah ! still you mock me with your cruel laugh .

sp.speaker: ALICIA
sp.p: It is your foolish epitaph .

lg.l: But this can be no mockery . Heave and sway
And curl and thrust - these waves are not at play .
You feel the ocean breaking on the shoal ;
But passionless and moveless is its soul .

sp.speaker: CRASSUS
sp.p: Ah ! but your soul is in your breath .

lg.l: Only as the graven image of death
Which men call life , and ignorantly adore !

sp.speaker: CRASSUS
sp.p: Spare me ! I cannot bear you more .

lg.l: Then will I drown you . Lock your fingers fast
In mind , and let our mouths mix at the last .
lg.stage: The stuatue of PAN is seen to be alive .

lg.l: Shrill , shrill
Over the hill !
The hunter is hot - this is the kill !
Scream ! Scream !
Dissolving the dream
Of life , the knife to the heart of the wife !
The fountain jets
Its flood of blood ,
And the moss that it wets
Is an amethyst flame of violets .
Who shall escape
Murder and rape
What I am alive in my solemn shape ?
Shrill , shrill ,
Over the hill !
The hunter is hot - this is the kill !
The heart of the home
Is a fury of foam ;
The storm is awake , and the billows comb .
But though I be
Their frenzy of glee ,
I am also the passionless soul of the sea !
Mine eyes glint fire ,
And my cruel lips curl ;
Mine the desire
Of the god and the girl ;
But fierier and fleeter ,
And subtler and sweeter
Than the race of the rhythm , the march of the metre ,
Is the shrilling , shrilling
Of the knife in the killing
That ends , when it must ,
lg.stage: O the throb and the thrust !
lg.l: In a death , in the dust ,
The silence , the stillness , of satiate lust ,
The solemn pause
When the veil withdraws
And man looks on his god , on the Causeless Cause .
Still , still ,
Under the hill !
The hunter is dead - this is the kill !

sp.speaker: CRASSUS
sp.p: Pan spoke .

lg.l: Pan never speaks till man is dumb ,
And only then if he be like a child
Silently curled within its mother 's womb ,
Or feeding at her breast . There is a wild
Way also - when his dumbness is of death .
And there 's a first and second death . Remember
To die so that no god 's or angel 's breath
May quicken into life the wasted ember !

sp.speaker: CRASSUS
sp.p: I am dead now .

lg.l: But I must raise you up .
The night grows darker ; all Pan 's light is gone ,
And you and I are pledged to sup
Upon a secret .

sp.speaker: CRASSUS
sp.p: All your secret shone .She laughs again .

lg.l: Oh , when you know it ! But you must divine
Adela 's shrine .

sp.speaker: CRASSUS
sp.p: I am weary of Adela grown chaste and chill .

sp.speaker: ALICIA
sp.p: The hunter lags ; how heavy is the hill ! But you are bound to Adela .

sp.speaker: CRASSUS
sp.p: To you !

sp.speaker: ALICIA
sp.p: But you have given me freedom . I will leave you .

sp.speaker: CRASSUS
sp.p: What have I done to grieve you ?

lg.l: You have been the solemn fool with face awry
That I have gathered in my ecstasy .
You are only a vulgar primrose I have plucked .

sp.speaker: CRASSUS
sp.p: At least , she-devil , you have been well-treated .

lg.l: O tragic farce - not even rimes completed !
Nay , darling ! no rebellion . When you know
My secret , you will understand . You are bound
To Adela within the portico ,
To me upon this ground .
By day , in life , adore the Lares , man !
By night , in deaht , make offering to Pan !
Can you cut day from night by any endeavour ?
If so , both life and death were lost for ever .
Come , the stream steepens .

sp.speaker: CRASSUS
sp.p: This road leads to hell .

sp.speaker: ALICIA
sp.p: The way to heaven is shorter .

sp.speaker: CRASSUS
sp.p: Who can tell ?

sp.speaker: ALICIA
sp.p: I have measured it .

sp.speaker: CRASSUS
sp.p: You , girl ?

sp.speaker: ALICIA
sp.p: It is not hard .

sp.speaker: CRASSUS
sp.p: What did you make the height of it ?

sp.speaker: ALICIA
sp.p: One yard .

sp.speaker: CRASSUS
sp.p: You always mock me ?

sp.speaker: ALICIA
sp.p: Pity of my youth ! I swerve not from , you stumble at , the truth .

sp.speaker: CRASSUS
sp.p: I like not jests . This is a serious journey .

lg.l: Why did you make a mocker your attorney ?
The way to Rome leads through the Apennines .
Bacchus has horns beneath the crown of vines .
If you fear horns , make some polite excuse
Not to invoke him by the name Zagreus !
A FAUN
Ye thought me a lamb
With a crown of thorns ;
I am royal , a ram
With death in my horns .
So mild and soft
And feminine ,
Ye held me aloft
And frowned on sin !
But I was awake
In your clasp as I lay ;
I roused the snake
From its nest of clay ;
And ere ye knew
I had sunk my forehead
Through and through ;
Harsh and horrid
Through all the pleasure
Of rose and vine
I thrust my treasure ,
The cone of the pine .
Irru 's maid
Was easily sated ,
For she was afraid
When Irru mated !

sp.speaker: CRASSUS
sp.p: Ha ! Ha ! Ha ! Ha ! Ha ! Ha !

lg.l: You would not laugh
Were you the maid !

sp.speaker: CRASSUS
sp.p: How could I be ?

lg.l: Great calf !
But you are all the same , blaspheme and jeer
At any mystery beyond your sphere
Of beer , and beef , and beer , and beef , and beer .
Now you have frightened the shy god !

sp.speaker: CRASSUS
sp.p: Why heed ? Between your - arms - is all the god I need .

lg.l: Prudish and coarse to the last . Now hush indeed !
The stream kisses the lake . We near the shrine .
Stir no snapped twig . Let your foot - even yours -
Fall like a fawn 's .

sp.speaker: CRASSUS
sp.p: Your breath is like new wine .

sp.speaker: ALICIA
sp.p: Hush now ! no porpoise gambols !

lg.l: How obscure 's
The glimmer of the lake . Is that the isle ?
Yes ! in that shadow lurks a smile .
See ; from that jagged cloud Diana starts
Like a deer from the brake ; her silver splendour darts
Through the crisp air to the grove upon the isle ...
Do you see her ? Do you see her ?

sp.speaker: CRASSUS
sp.p: Monstrous ! Vile ! These eyes betray me .

lg.l: No ! your Adela lies
With arms thrown back , head tilted , open thighs .
Her lips flame out like poppies in the dusk .
The breeze brings back to us a scent of musk .
Her mouth is oozing kisses !

sp.speaker: CRASSUS
sp.p: Filthy harlot !

lg.l: I never fed on a superber scarlet .
And look ! the wonder of plumes that foams upon
Her tidal breast - oh , but a swan ! a swan !
A swan snow-white with his sole scarlet hidden
In the abode forbidden !
O but his eye swoons as his broad beak slips
Within her luscious lips .
O but - I cannot see - I long to die
Alike for wonder - and for jealousy !

sp.speaker: CRASSUS
sp.p: Vile , filthy whore ! I 'll catch you at it .

sp.speaker: ALICIA
sp.p: Soft ! See how his feathers hold her soul aloft !

sp.speaker: CRASSUS
sp.p: Beast ! Have you brought me through the wood for this ?

sp.speaker: ALICIA
sp.p: Now wonder I must teach you how to kiss .

sp.speaker: CRASSUS
sp.p: I 'll clip his wings .

sp.speaker: ALICIA
sp.p: Sub pennis , penis ! ‘ Slife ! It 's not the wings of him that clip your wife .

sp.speaker: CRASSUS
sp.p: Thou art as filthy a creature as she !

sp.speaker: ALICIA
sp.p: Fat fool ! All your emotions vary with your -

sp.speaker: CRASSUS
sp.p: What ?

sp.speaker: ALICIA
sp.p: Your state of health .

sp.speaker: CRASSUS
sp.p: Be off with you , foul —

sp.speaker: ALICIA
sp.p: Well ?

lg.l: I 'll swim and stab them . The black mouth of hell
Yawns for their murder .

sp.speaker: ALICIA
sp.p: I 'll be at the death . Dive then , but softly . Scarcely draw your breath .

sp.speaker: CRASSUS
sp.p: O , she 's unwary !

sp.speaker: ALICIA
sp.p: Is your love forgotten ?

sp.speaker: CRASSUS
sp.p: All love is rotten .

sp.speaker: ALICIA
sp.p: But your pure love for me you boasted of ?

sp.speaker: CRASSUS
sp.p: Ay , that was perfect love .

sp.speaker: ALICIA
sp.p: You love me then , not her ?

sp.speaker: CRASSUS
sp.p: Indeed I do .

sp.speaker: ALICIA
sp.p: Swear me the oath anew !

sp.speaker: CRASSUS
sp.p: I swear to love you till the world shall end .

sp.speaker: ALICIA
sp.p: Then , Crassus , I will always be your friend .

sp.speaker: CRASSUS
sp.p: Ah , that is good ! You do not mock me now !

sp.speaker: ALICIA
sp.p: Creep softly to the land . Kiss but my brow . My curls are wet ... No , never touch me there !

sp.speaker: CRASSUS
sp.p: Why ? Have I not ?

sp.speaker: ALICIA
sp.p: You have not .

sp.speaker: CRASSUS
sp.p: Just my hand .

lg.l: You disobey your mistress 's command ?
The time is near when you shall see
The keyhole of my comedy !

sp.speaker: CRASSUS
sp.p: Ha ! Ha ! Ha !

lg.l: Hush , you coarse slave ; we 'll surprise
Your good wife in her mystic exercise .
Quick , through the bramble !

sp.speaker: CRASSUS
sp.p: Now , you beast , I 've got you ! The curst of God , and plague of Naples , rot you ! For this white brute - one slit !He cuts the throat of THE SWAN with his dagger .

lg.l: Oh love betrayed !
O my dead beauty ! Faugh ! deceitful maid .
Not Crassus found me out . Had I the wings
Of my dead love - oh love ! -

sp.speaker: ALICIA
sp.p: Why , wondrous things !

sp.speaker: ADELA
sp.p: These nails shall serve . A servant !

lg.l: She shall be
My wife , damned witch , when I have done with thee !

sp.speaker: ADELA
sp.p: I 'll kill her now . But see ! my swan is dead .

sp.speaker: ALICIA
sp.p: Yes ! and what light is breaking overhead ? What blaze of blue and gold envelops us ?

sp.speaker: CRASSUS
sp.p: O marvel ! O miraculous !

lg.l: What is it ? Why , my lover 's life , in me
Once concentrated , now diffused , illumes
The endless reaches of eternity
With infinite brilliance , with intense perfumes .

sp.speaker: ALICIA
sp.p: O then your lover was some god 's disguise .

sp.speaker: ADELA
sp.p: And you have robbed me . Now beware your eyes !She springs at ALICIA , who guards herself easily . But in the struggle her robe tears .

sp.speaker: ALICIA
sp.p: Take care !

sp.speaker: ADELA
sp.p: A boy !

sp.speaker: CRASSUS
sp.p: A boy ! Then what am I ?

sp.speaker: ALICIA
sp.p: That is the key-word of the comedy . You thought you had two vices at your need ; But she had Jove and you had Ganymede .They are struck dumb and still with amazement . ALICIA claps her hands four times .Sweep through the air , bright blaze of eagle-wings ! Crassus , sub pennis , penis ! How he swings His bulk from yonder sightless poise , to bear me back to the Dominion of the air Where I shall bear the cup of Jupiter ! Blind babes , love one another , no less true Because the gods have deigned to dwell with you !The eagle bears GANYMEDE aloft .

lg.l: Adela ! these mysteries too great
For you and me to estimate .
But , widowed both , come , seek domestic charms
As we were wont , in one another 's arms !
What perfect moss for you to lie upon !

sp.speaker: ADELA
sp.p: I am your wife , dear Crassus .sotto voceOh , my swan !
